headshotImage.longCaption: Mahmudullah headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Mahmudullah b Shoriful Islam 120 (122b 11x4 1x6 163m) SR: 98.36

dismissalComment.html: stunning catch! And reward for Shoriful, he's bowled smart this spell. Good length, on off, not full enough for the drive, but Perera goes for it nonetheless. Slices the drive, and Mahmudullah at mid off has to run backwards, following the ball from over his shoulder, and dives to take a catch. A wonderful century comes to an end

dismissalComment.html: gets the breakthrough! And a big "come on boys" roar from Taskin. Fullish, on off. Minimal footwork as he tries to muscle it over midwicket. Inside edge, crashes into the stumps, and Bangladesh break the partnership after 82 runs

image.caption: Pathum Nissanka portrait
image.longCaption: Pathum Nissanka portrait, Antigua and Barbuda, March 12, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Pathum Nissaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Pathum Nissaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and Taskin is on fire! This time, the "come on boys" is even louder. Good length ball outside off and jagging in. Nissanka looks to punch through the covers, but it takes the edge. Keeper moves to his right and pockets that. Duck for Pathum and Bangladesh have come roaring back on the back of this Taskin over

image.caption: Kusal Mendis portrait
image.longCaption: Kusal Mendis, May 2020

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at mid-off. Third wicket for Taskin, the bowling change works. Not a shot Mendis will want to look at on replays. Ugly slog across the line to a back of length ball on off stump, gets it off the toe end and it lobs gently to the fielder. Didn't move his feet at all, and was the wrong choice of shot for that length and line in any case

headshotImage.caption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: taken at long-on, as Mehidy moves to his left. Taskin went full on off, as Hasaranga swung his bat in search of a late flourish. But that came off the bottom of the bat and couldn't find the distance. Taskin has four now, first time since 2017 that he has taken as many in an ODI.

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c †Dickwella b Fernando 53 (63b 2x4 1x6 88m) SR: 84.12

dismissalComment.html: caught behind on the ramp. That is that and Sri Lanka have won by 97 runs. This was a slower ball, dug in short. Mahmudullah hasn't been reading the changes of pace that well, moved across to ramp it, was way too early into the shot and ended up getting a toe-end that Dickwella jumped up and caught.

dismissalText.commentary: Mosaddek Hossain c Fernando b RTM Mendis 51 (72b 3x4 1x6 90m) SR: 70.83

dismissalComment.html: goes for the reverse-sweep, and is taken at short third man. Top-edges it, as Mendis pitches it full on middle. They were in need of a boundary, but Mosaddek has thrown in away. It seemed to be a pre-meditated shot, as he knew the man was inside the circle at short third man. But he can't find the middle of the bat, as Bangladesh lose half the side.

image.caption: Dushmantha Chameera portrait
image.longCaption: Dushmantha Chameera, June 2020

image.longCaption: Mohammad Naim Sheikh portrait, April 2020

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Naim player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Naim player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at slip. Success for Chameera with his first ball. He angled this well across Naim, and the ball ended up well wide of off, but Naim was drawn into driving at that with feet mostly static. Gets a healthy edge and slip takes a comfortable catch

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan portrait
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan portrait, April 2020

headshotImage.caption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

dismissalComment.html: smart catch at square leg and a great short ball. Bent his back on this, and banged it in short, got it perfectly on target, rising up uncomfortably towards Shakib's throat. He's cramped for room too, and the attempted pull shot is almost a reflex. It's a very limp effort though and the ball lobs up. Square leg judges the height and times his jump to catch it to a nicety. Huge wicket

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal portrait
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal portrait, April 2020

headshotImage.caption: Tamim Iqbal headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalComment.html: slower delivery that the bowler thinks he's nicked behind and the umpire agrees. But Tamim going for the review immediately. This was full, almost yorker length going past him in the channel. Very close to bat, but bat also hit ground when ball was passing, so the noise could be from that. Ooh this is touch and go. The bat is hitting the ground right at the moment when the ball's passing the edge! Is there enough evidence to over-turn the on-field decision? I don't think so. The ball's very close to the bat too. I'd say this was out. And the third umpire concurs, so Chameera has a third wicket. Tamim is stunned. He's muttering animatedly as he walks off.

image.caption: Mehidy Hasan portrait
image.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan portrait, April 2020

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: there's number four! Short ball, outside off, and Mehidy wants to pull it. But the ball's rising, and he slices the shot. Pops up in the air, beaten by pace, and comfortably taken at midwicket. His first career four-for

image.caption: Taskin Ahmed portrait
image.longCaption: Taskin Ahmed portrait, April 2020

headshotImage.caption: Taskin Ahmed headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Taskin Ahmed headshot

dismissalComment.html: there's the five for! Comes around the wicket. Puts in the yorker, and the batter can't get his bat down in time. Stumps knocked back, the perfect ball to a lower-order batter

headshotImage.caption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Afif Hossain player portrait
image.longCaption: Afif Hossain player portrait

headshotImage.caption: Afif Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Afif Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: pocketed by short fine leg! Tosses it up, looks to sweep, but top-edges it. Hasaranga's first wicket of the evening

image.caption: Shoriful Islam player portrait
image.longCaption: Shoriful Islam player portrait

headshotImage.caption: Shoriful Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoriful Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: stumped by a mile. He's actually caught behind first. Shoriful danced down the track, and Hasranga bowled the perfectly flighted googly to the left-hander. Dipped on him, and spun away, even as he swung his bat in a golf arc, got a thick edge that Dickwella snapped up, and broke the bails too for good effect with the batsman well out of his crease.

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c RTM Mendis b Chameera 4 (7b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: smart catch at square leg and a great short ball. Bent his back on this, and banged it in short, got it perfectly on target, rising up uncomfortably towards Shakib's throat. He's cramped for room too, and the attempted pull shot is almost a reflex. It's a very limp effort though and the ball lobs up. Square leg judges the height and times his jump to catch it to a nicety. Huge wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c †Dickwella b Chameera 17 (29b 2x4 0x6 46m) SR: 58.62

dismissalComment.html: slower delivery that the bowler thinks he's nicked behind and the umpire agrees. But Tamim going for the review immediately. This was full, almost yorker length going past him in the channel. Very close to bat, but bat also hit ground when ball was passing, so the noise could be from that. Ooh this is touch and go. The bat is hitting the ground right at the moment when the ball's passing the edge! Is there enough evidence to over-turn the on-field decision? I don't think so. The ball's very close to the bat too. I'd say this was out. And the third umpire concurs, so Chameera has a third wicket. Tamim is stunned. He's muttering animatedly as he walks off.

dismissalComment.html: caught at long-on! A memorable first ODI wicket to have. Mushfiqur danced down to this ball, as Mendis went full on middle. The batter never got the timing right, as the bat twisted in his hand. Not sure if that was required at this stage, with the required rate around eight an over and not many batters in form. But Bangladesh's highest run-getter of the series can't bail them out this time.

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c †Dickwella b Fernando 53 (63b 2x4 1x6 88m) SR: 84.12

commentTextItems.html: caught behind on the ramp. That is that and Sri Lanka have won by 97 runs. This was a slower ball, dug in short. Mahmudullah hasn't been reading the changes of pace that well, moved across to ramp it, was way too early into the shot and ended up getting a toe-end that Dickwella jumped up and caught.

commentPostTextItems.html: 9.03 pm: And that brings us to the end of our coverage for this match and series too. On behalf of Sreshth, Himanshu, Thilak and Raghav, this is Saurabh Somani signing off.
The BCB president hands over the trophy to Tamim. Bangladesh have won the series of course, and Sri Lanka have won the match. Something for everyone.

Kusal Perera: Badly needed win, but we lost the series. My innings, I took calculated risks in the first 10 overs. Once I get set, I try to bat for 30-35 overs. I took my chances and once you get set you have to get a big one. 50-60 is not enough for the team, so once I got set I changed gears to try and bat long. Our bowling department did a really good job. Our only concern in the first two games was the batting. Otherwise fielding and bowling we have done well. Some of the guys coming into touch is a good sign.

Mushfiqur Rahim is the Man of the Series: I think the boys did a great job, they worked really hard for this series. Last couple of months we haven't played our best cricket but luckily we executed our plans well in the first two games. Unfortunately we couldn't finish it off on a high. Playing international cricket for 15+ years, you need to contribute more and more for your country and that's what I try to do each game. Sri Lanka are not an easy side to play against, they never give up and come hard. I really enjoyed (the pressure). Whenever there is pressure or expectation, I try to stay calm. I know the opponent might also think I'm a big player, that gives me an edge.

Dushmantha Chameera is the Man of the Match: Very happy with the way I bowled. Good performance on a comeback. Was not under pressure coming into this series. Pleased with the role I'm playing for Sri Lanka and how I'm bowling.

Tamim Iqbal: As I said at the end of the last game and beginning of this game, we have won the series but I thought we never played a complete game. We didn't play to our potential in this series. After winning the series, I can tell you there are a few areas to work on.

They had a very attacking mindset coming into this game and we helped them do that. We bowled too short. We didn't grab our opportunities, missed two catches at important times, and could have probably got 30 runs less to chase. (Dependency on seniors a worry?) It is, but I am someone who keeps believing in youngsters. I don't point fingers at them, because I know how hard they try. If they perform we will become a better team but it's always easy to criticise. I'm not someone who will criticise my own players.
There are lots of things I want to achieve individually and as a leader of this team.

While waiting for the presentations, here's something from off the field in Sri Lanka. Aravinda de Silva, the legendary former player, has said the current players shouldn't complain about their contracts and focus on winning instead.

Just to refresh, Aravinda has played possibly the best game anyone has ever had in a World Cup final. Best batsman, best bowler, all-round champion. It's the performance Mahela Jaywardene recently said he wished he had in his career. (And Mahela is not alone, we've all wished for the same in front of our mirrors).

8.38 pm: Sri Lanka have got 10 Super League points and lifted themselves off the negative points they had (for slow over-rate). They will be pleased with this win, dead rubber or not. There's a big difference between losing 2-1 and 3-0, and Sri Lanka had a lot of good performances to take away from this game. Kusal Perera and Dushmantha Chameera led the way of course with bat and ball, but there were several useful nuggets of contribution from a host of others too. Three players on debut too, and it's always nice to start your careers with such a commanding win.

commentTextItems.html: attempted yorker gone wrong, ends up as a highish full toss on off and he opens the face to drive through point and raises fifty. In a lost cause today, but he's fought well

commentPreTextItems.html: The Fizz is the last man, but he'll be at the bowler's end.

commentTextItems.html: slower bouncer, and he didn't read the change of pace, so had to bail out of the intended pull shot. Bounced in front of the keeper who couldn't collect, and it runs away behind him for four byes.

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c †Dickwella b Chameera 17 (29b 2x4 0x6 46m) SR: 58.62

dismissalComment.html: slower delivery that the bowler thinks he's nicked behind and the umpire agrees. But Tamim going for the review immediately. This was full, almost yorker length going past him in the channel. Very close to bat, but bat also hit ground when ball was passing, so the noise could be from that. Ooh this is touch and go. The bat is hitting the ground right at the moment when the ball's passing the edge! Is there enough evidence to over-turn the on-field decision? I don't think so. The ball's very close to the bat too. I'd say this was out. And the third umpire concurs, so Chameera has a third wicket. Tamim is stunned. He's muttering animatedly as he walks off.

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c RTM Mendis b Chameera 4 (7b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: smart catch at square leg and a great short ball. Bent his back on this, and banged it in short, got it perfectly on target, rising up uncomfortably towards Shakib's throat. He's cramped for room too, and the attempted pull shot is almost a reflex. It's a very limp effort though and the ball lobs up. Square leg judges the height and times his jump to catch it to a nicety. Huge wicket

dismissalComment.html: caught at long-on! A memorable first ODI wicket to have. Mushfiqur danced down to this ball, as Mendis went full on middle. The batter never got the timing right, as the bat twisted in his hand. Not sure if that was required at this stage, with the required rate around eight an over and not many batters in form. But Bangladesh's highest run-getter of the series can't bail them out this time.

dismissalComment.html: smart catch at square leg and a great short ball. Bent his back on this, and banged it in short, got it perfectly on target, rising up uncomfortably towards Shakib's throat. He's cramped for room too, and the attempted pull shot is almost a reflex. It's a very limp effort though and the ball lobs up. Square leg judges the height and times his jump to catch it to a nicety. Huge wicket

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal portrait
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal portrait, April 2020

headshotImage.caption: Tamim Iqbal headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalComment.html: slower delivery that the bowler thinks he's nicked behind and the umpire agrees. But Tamim going for the review immediately. This was full, almost yorker length going past him in the channel. Very close to bat, but bat also hit ground when ball was passing, so the noise could be from that. Ooh this is touch and go. The bat is hitting the ground right at the moment when the ball's passing the edge! Is there enough evidence to over-turn the on-field decision? I don't think so. The ball's very close to the bat too. I'd say this was out. And the third umpire concurs, so Chameera has a third wicket. Tamim is stunned. He's muttering animatedly as he walks off.
